Impact (reported): Kharkiv mayor said a large energy facility was destroyed; continued strain on heat supply after earlier attacks.
Source title: Russia destroys large energy facility in Kharkiv, mayor says
Key findings (from source): Local officials reported Russian strikes destroyed a major energy facility near Kharkiv, underscoring the winter campaign against power/heat infrastructure.

Impact (reported): Security Service of Ukraine (SBU) presented evidence framing systematic energy strikes as crimes against humanity (per article).
Source title: Kyiv energy crisis 'extremely serious,' as SBU presents evidence of crime against humanity
Key findings (from source): The SBU argued Russia’s repeated attacks on energy and heat supply systems are systematic and aimed at civilian harm, documenting hundreds of strikes since the 2025 heating season began.

Impact (reported): President ordered acceleration of electricity imports and acquisition of additional power equipment amid severe energy crisis.
Source title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy orders faster imports of electricity, power equipment
Key findings (from source): Zelenskiy instructed authorities to speed up electricity imports and procurement of power equipment to stabilize supplies during the worst wartime energy crunch.

Impact (reported): Drone barrage hit energy targets; power cut in multiple regions amid freezing temperatures; large drone interception reported.
Source title: Russia hits energy system in several regions of Ukraine, Kyiv says
Key findings (from source): Ukrainian officials said Russia launched a large drone wave targeting energy sites, leading to outages in several regions during peak winter demand.

Impact (reported): Combined drone/missile attack disrupted electricity and water supplies in Kyiv; injuries reported; broader impacts on grid resilience.
Source title: Russian attack plunges Kyiv into cold, threatens nuclear-... (power/water disruptions)
Key findings (from source): Kyiv officials reported power and water supply disruptions after combined drone and missile strikes, highlighting continued pressure on critical utilities.

Impact (reported): Heating restored to >1,600 buildings; ~4,000 buildings still without heat after latest strikes; repeated reconnections needed.
Source title: Heating restored to over 1600 apartment buildings in Kyiv, while 4000 remain without heat
Key findings (from source): City authorities said heating was partially restored, but thousands of buildings remained without heat after repeated damage from multiple attack waves.

Impact (reported): Ukraine and the Netherlands agreed to urgent support measures for energy resilience and heat supply.
Source (publisher): Ministry for Development of Communities and Territories of Ukraine
Source title: Ukraine and the Netherlands join forces to provide urgent support to energy and district heating sectors
Key findings (from source): The ministry reported coordination with the Netherlands to deliver urgent assistance for energy and district-heating infrastructure under attack-related stress.

Impact (reported): Reuters described severe winter conditions and repeated energy strikes leaving households without heat/power; coping measures highlighted.
Source title: Ukraine endures its bitterest winter as Russia targets heating and power
Key findings (from source): Reuters reported widespread outages amid sub-zero temperatures, illustrating how repeated strikes on heat and power systems translate into acute civilian hardship.

Impact (reported): Ukrenergo said the energy situation significantly worsened; emergency outages introduced in most regions; generation facilities under emergency repair.
Source title: Ukraine's grid operator says energy situation has 'significantly' worsened
Key findings (from source): Ukrenergo reported the system had deteriorated after recent strikes, prompting emergency power cuts and urgent repairs at generation facilities.

Impact (reported): European Commission deployed 447 emergency generators from EU strategic reserves (value €3.7m) for hospitals, shelters, critical services.
Source title: EU deploys emergency generators as Russian strikes leave over 1 million without power in -20°C
Key findings (from source): The Commission said it was deploying hundreds of generators from strategic reserves to restore power for essential services amid large-scale outage impacts.

Impact (reported): Massive drone/missile assault left ~1.2 million properties without electricity; thousands of Kyiv buildings without heating; rare missile types reported.
Source title: Russian air attack knocks out power for over a million Ukrainians
Key findings (from source): Reuters reported a large-scale strike wave hitting the energy system, causing widespread blackouts and heating disruptions in severe cold.

Impact (reported): UN humanitarian coordinator condemned strikes; noted thousands without electricity/heating/water; highlighted repeated January attack waves.
Source title: ‘Cycle of attacks must end’: Lead UN official in Ukraine
Key findings (from source): UN statement emphasized that systematic attacks on energy infrastructure are leaving civilians without basic services in extreme cold and must stop.

Impact (reported): Report linked large strike wave to ongoing peace talks; highlighted extensive outage figures and infrastructure damage in two largest cities.
Source title: Russia launches 'brutal' attack on Ukraine as peace talks continue
Key findings (from source): The Guardian described the scale of the attack and its timing alongside talks, noting extensive power losses and damage to essential services.

Impact (reported): DTEK CEO appealed for equipment/financing support to rebuild damaged energy infrastructure and keep services running through winter.
Source title: DTEK Ukraine pleads for aid to rebuild energy infrastructure
Key findings (from source): DTEK’s CEO urged European firms and banks to supply equipment and funding for rebuilding power assets heavily damaged by repeated strikes.

Impact (reported): Kyiv mayor said >1,300 apartment buildings remained without heat after major energy strike; nationwide power disruptions persisted.
Source title: Russian strike on Ukraine's Kyiv leaves 1,330 buildings still without heat, mayor says
Key findings (from source): Officials reported ongoing restoration with a large number of apartment blocks still without heat following recent large-scale strikes on energy infrastructure.

Impact (reported): Hourly outage schedules for households nationwide; power limits for industry due to consequences of strikes on energy facilities.
Source title: Power outage schedules to apply in all regions on Sunday – Ukrenergo
Key findings (from source): Ukrenergo announced nationwide hourly outage schedules for households and restrictions for industrial users amid strike-related system strain.

Impact (reported): Lithuania pledged nearly 100 generators for Ukrainian communities; leaders discussed energy-system support and air defense.
Source title: Presidents of Ukraine and Lithuania Discussed Support for the Ukrainian Energy System
Key findings (from source): Official readout said Lithuania would provide ~100 generators and discussed broader energy resilience support amid daily attacks on the energy system.

Impact (reported): Strikes in Odesa damaged an energy facility and killed civilians; power knocked out for ~80% of Kharkiv and surrounding region (per officials).
Source title: Russian strikes kill 2 in Odesa, knock out power in Kharkiv
Key findings (from source): Reuters reported civilian casualties and major regional outages following missile and drone strikes, with Kharkiv experiencing extensive power loss.

Impact (reported): ArcelorMittal said extremely high electricity costs in Ukraine contributed to closing a unit; attacks causing blackouts and supply restrictions noted.
Source title: ArcelorMittal to close unit at Ukraine plant amid green rules, Russian attacks
Key findings (from source): Company cited high power costs and unstable supply as an additional burden, illustrating how grid damage and restrictions affect heavy industry decisions.

Location: Western Ukraine (reported: Lviv region / Brody area)
Impact (reported): Naftogaz said a Russian strike hit a facility, causing a fire and halting operations; described as among multiple direct attacks in 2026.
Source title: Ukraine's Naftogaz says Russia struck its facility in western Ukraine
Key findings (from source): Naftogaz reported a strike on its infrastructure in western Ukraine that caused a fire and forced suspension of operations at the site.
